page.title: 04General Information Three
page.content:
Hiltingbury is a quiet residential area of Chandler's ford. One of it's main features being the trees which line the roads and dominate the gardens.
Evidence from{Tumulii}show the area was used in the{Bronze Age}and it is known that the woodland around was tenanted by copyholders.
In more recent times the land to the West was farmed. A new housing estate now covers the old{Hiltonbury Farm}and more of the area is being sold for future expansion.
During World War Two 10,000 troops assembled for ther D-Day Landings in Hiltingbury. Later the area was used as a camp by Polish refugees.
